description.narrative:
Team will train local malaria post worker from each village to chlorinate the household water of all villagers and to provide ongoing Health Education to the community.
Team will provide medical care at the same time for both general medical care and diarrhea cases.
Team will call a community meeting in each village and provide education on Hygiene promotion, local common diseases especially diarrhea, importance of chlorine treated water and use of boiled water, environmental Sanitation, and general Water and Sanitation messages. Local Malaria Post from each village will lead the Health Education session.
Team will make assessment to each village they visit. The assessment form will include water source of the village, toilet facilities, household hand washing practices and facilities, and village population profile.

This project, in partnership with local partners, aims to provide emergency health care to communities affected by recent outbreaks of cholera and severe diarrhea, provide training on water chlorination, assess water and sanitation in communities who are at high risk of waterborne disease, and provide health education in villages that are at high risk of water-borne disease.
